member.name: IAMStats.AddValue

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The AddValue method records a new value.

member.param: Specifies the index of the statistic.
Specifies the value to record.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMStats.GetIndex

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetIndex method retrieves the index for a named statistic, or creates a new statistic.

member.param: Specifies the name of the statistic.

Specifies whether to create the statistic, if it is not defined already. If the value is TRUE, the method creates a new index for the statistic when it cannot find an existing entry with that name. If the value is FALSE, the method fails when the statistic does not already exist.
Receives the index.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMStats.GetValueByIndex

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetValueByIndex method retrieves a statistic, by index.

member.param: Zero-based index of the statistic.
Pointer to a variable that receives the name of the statistic.
Pointer to a variable that receives the number of values that were recorded.
Pointer to a variable that receives the most recent value that was recorded.
Pointer to a variable that receives the average value.
Pointer to a variable that receives the standard deviation of the values. If the count is less than two, the standard deviation is zero.
Pointer to a variable that receives the minimum value that was recorded.
Pointer to a variable that receives the maximum value that was recorded.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMStats.GetValueByName

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetValueByName method retrieves a statistic, by name.

member.param: Specifies the name of the statistic.
Pointer to a variable that receives the index of this statistic.
Pointer to a variable that receives the number of values that were recorded.
Pointer to a variable that receives the most recent value that was recorded.
Pointer to a variable that receives the average value.
Pointer to a variable that receives the standard deviation of the values. If the count is less than two, the standard deviation is zero.
Pointer to a variable that receives the minimum value that was recorded.
Pointer to a variable that receives the maximum value that was recorded.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMStats.get_Count

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_Count method retrieves the number of statistics.

member.param: Receives the number of statistics.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMStats.Reset

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The Reset method resets all statistics to zero.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IAMStats interface retrieves performance data from the Filter Graph Manager. Filters can use this interface to record performance data.
Filter developers: As with all Filter Graph Manager interfaces, a filter must not hold a reference count on this interface, or it will cause a circular reference count. For more information, see .
